data.text: Then Job spoke again, saying to Eliphaz,
“If all my troubles and misery could be put on a scale and weighed,
they would be heavier than all the sands on the shores of the oceans.
It is as though Almighty God has shot me with arrows.
Just like a wild donkey does not complain by braying when it has plenty of grass to eat,
People complain [RHQ] when they must eat food which has no salt
Just like I do not want to eat food like that,
“I wish that God would do for me what I have requested from him [DOU].
I wish that he would crush me and let me die.
If he would do that, I would be comforted by knowing that in spite of the great pain that I have suffered,
But now I do not have [RHQ] enough strength to endure all these things.
I am not [RHQ] strong like rocks are,
So I am not able to help myself,
“When a man has many troubles, his friends should be kind to him,
But you, my friends, are not dependable.
when the melting ice and snow make those streams overflow,
but when the dry season comes, there is no water flowing in those streams,
The caravans of merchants turn off the path to search for some water,
The men in those caravans search for some water
But they do not find any,
Similarly, you friends have not helped me at all!
After I lost all my wealth, did I ask any of you for money? [RHQ]
Have I asked any of you to rescue me from my enemies [RHQ]?
“Answer me now, and then I will be quiet;
When people speak what is true, that will not hurt the person who hears it,
I am a man who has nothing to hope for,
You do not sympathize with me at all for all that I am suffering.
Please look at me! I will not [RHQ] lie to you.
Stop saying that I have sinned, and stop criticizing me unjustly!
Do you think that I am lying?
